code: @Manual{,   title = {gvsu215: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts},   author = {Ian Curtis},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/ian-curtis/gvsu215, https://gvsu215.ianacurtis.com}, }

what: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts
title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts
text: Note: Due fact functions return tables (essentially HTML code), README GitHub display properly. result, output image resulting table rather actual HTML table. gvsu215 contains series wrapper functions around select mosaic ggformula functions, help flextable. goal provide introductory statistics students/learners easy way generate nice-looking plots tables without focusing code used create . tables plots generated package doctored themes pre-applied. , output print “messy” format R console can used interactively, including R Markdown documents. package designed tailored Grand Valley State University (course code: STA 215) can used anyone.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts
text: can install development version gvsu215 GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ian-curtis/gvsu215")

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts
text: order use package, need basic understanding R syntax run function preferred working environment. Functions use formula syntax (e.g., var1 ~ var2) thus knowledge formulas needed well.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts
text: package best used creating simple plots charts extensive customization necessary. instance, may just want see summary statistics, including one- two-way tables.   maybe just need percentiles:  also support variety plots…    … statistical inference.
code: library(gvsu215) tbl_2var(mtcars, gear~cyl) tbl_num_sum(mtcars, ~wt, na_rm = TRUE) tbl_pctile(mtcars, ~wt, probs = c(0, .25, .4, .5, .6, .75, 1)) plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "percent") plot_box(mtcars,           wt~gear,           fill = 'orangered4',           x = "Gear",           y = "Weight",           title = "Boxplot of Weight by Gear") plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat) #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots. infer_1prop(mtcars, ~vs, success = 1) infer_paired(mtcars, var1 = ~drat, var2 = ~wt) infer_2mean_int(mtcars, wt~vs) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear)) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear, type = "expected")) infer_anova(mtcars, cyl~gear, digits = 2)

what: Help, Bug Reports, and Feature Requests
title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Basic Statistical Concepts

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: Used internally detect user inputted confidence level correctly (.e., quotes decimal).

code: check_conf_lvl(level)

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: level confidence level question

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: Nothing, error message.

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
code: check_conf_lvl(.95) try(check_conf_lvl("95%")) #> Error in check_conf_lvl("95%") :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive (not in quotes). try(check_conf_lvl(95)) #> Error in check_conf_lvl(95) :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive (not in quotes).

what: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Used internally check error might occur later. catch error provide helpful message users based common cause errors.

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: check_test(code)

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: code code try run

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Nothing, error message.

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: library(stats)  check_test(head(mtcars)) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1 try(check_test(head(Mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.  check_test(lm(wt~drat, data = mtcars)) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = wt ~ drat, data = mtcars) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)         drat   #>       7.906       -1.304   #>  try(check_test(lm(Wt~drat, data = mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.

what: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: Create simple bar plot

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
code: plot_bar(   data,   formula,   type = c("percent", "count"),   fill = "#0032A0",   title = NULL,   na_rm = FALSE,   ... )

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: data data frame. formula variable tabulate. given formula notation, ~var. type type plot create. Valid options "percent" (default) "count". fill fill plot. Valid options character color (one variable plots) variable given formula notation (~var), used create grouped bar plot. title override title plot. sensible default provided. na_rm missing values removed? Defaults FALSE. ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: ggplot object. interactive session, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
code: plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl) #> No value for type provided, creating a 'Percent' plot.  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "count") #> Error in eval(parse(text = text, keep.source = FALSE), envir): object 'fill_var' not found plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "percent", fill = "yellowgreen")   plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, fill = ~gear) #> No value for type provided, creating a 'Percent' plot.  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "count", fill = ~gear) #> Error in eval(parse(text = text, keep.source = FALSE), envir): object 'fill_var' not found

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: plot_box() builds simple, pre-themed boxplot one variable alone grouped another variable.

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
code: plot_box(data, formula, fill = "grey80", title = NULL, na_rm = FALSE, ...)

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: data data frame. formula Variables entered formula notation. Either ~var one-variable boxplot var1~var2 grouped boxplot var2 grouping variable. fill fill color boxplot. Entered character. title override title plot. sensible default provided. na_rm missing values removed? Defaults FALSE. ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: ggplot object. interactive environment, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
code: plot_box(mtcars, ~wt)  plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear, fill = 'orangered4')  plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear)

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: plot_hist() builds histogram one variable alone grouped single, categorical grouping variable. number grouped plot columns can adjusted based levels grouping variable.

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
code: plot_hist(   data,   formula,   fill = "#0032A0",   binwidth = NULL,   group = NULL,   group_cols = 1,   title = NULL,   na_rm = FALSE,   ... )

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: data data frame. formula variable tabulate. given formula notation, ~var. fill fill color bins, entered character. binwidth width bins, entered number. group grouping (faceting) variable entered formula syntax, ~group_var. group_cols number columns make grouped (faceted) plot. Defaults 1 (stacked vertical plots). title override title plot. sensible default provided. na_rm missing values removed? Defaults FALSE. ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: ggplot object. interactive environment, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
code: plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat) #> Warning: No value for breaks supplied. Your histogram may not show your data accurately.  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, binwidth = 0.05)  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, binwidth = 0.05, fill = "red")   plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, binwidth = 0.05, group = ~cyl)  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, binwidth = 0.05, group = ~cyl, group_cols = 2)

title: Create a simple scatterplot — plot_scatter
text: plot_scatter() creates pre-themed scatterplot two variables, optionally grouped third categorical variable.

title: Create a simple scatterplot — plot_scatter
code: plot_scatter(   data,   formula,   fill = "#0032a0",   title = NULL,   legend_title = NULL,   axis_lines = c("none", "both"),   ls_line = FALSE,   ... )

title: Create a simple scatterplot — plot_scatter
text: data data frame. formula Variables build plot . entered formula notation, var1~var2. fill fill plot. Valid options character color (standard scatterplots) variable given formula notation (~var), used create grouped scatterplot. title override title plot. sensible default provided. legend_title title lengend. Ignored non-grouped plots. Default variable name. axis_lines major axis lines appear plot? Valid options "none" ". Defaults "none". ls_line least squares line (lines) appear plot? Defaults FALSE. ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple scatterplot — plot_scatter
text: ggplot object. interactive environment, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple scatterplot — plot_scatter
code: plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat) #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots.  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = "red") #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots.  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, axis_lines = "both") #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots.   plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = ~cyl) #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots.  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = ~cyl, legend_title = "Cyl") #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots.

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: tbl_pctile() wrapper around mosaic::quantile() creates tidy table data values given percentiles.

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
code: tbl_pctile(   data,   formula,   digits = 3,   probs = c(0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1),   caption = NULL,   na_rm = FALSE )

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: data data frame (tibble). formula Variables summarize given formula notation: ~var1 var1~var2. var1 numeric var2, supplied, grouping variable. digits number digits round . Defaults 3. probs vector percentiles compute. value must 0 1, inclusive. Defaults 0, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%. caption override table caption. sensible default given. na_rm missing values removed? Defaults FALSE.

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: object class flextable. interactive session, table viewable immediately.

title: gvsu215 0.3.0
text: tbl_one() –> tbl_1var() tbl_two() –> tbl_2var() num_sum() –> tbl_num_sum() pctile() –> tbl_pctile() corr() –> tbl_corr() infer_mean1() –> infer_1mean() infer_mean2() –> infer_2mean() infer_prop1() –> infer_1prop() infer_mean2_int() –> infer_2mean_int() infer_mean2_test() –> infer_2mean_test() infer_prop2_int() –> infer_2prop_int() infer_prop2_test() –> infer_2prop_test()

title: gvsu215 0.3.0
text: package vignette (README) changed import images tables. HTML output code work well GitHub tables don’t appear .

title: gvsu215 0.2.0
text: Two functions renamed. one_way() now tbl_one() two_way() now tbl_two(). old functions available. plot_scatter(): default value legend_title now NULL (supplied variable name). can still supply new string legend title.

title: gvsu215 0.2.0
text: two_way() (tbl_two()) output cleaned plot_box() plot_hist() now scientific notation certain ranges numbers corr() now shows observations used (since always just sum n1 n2 missing) added confidence interval infer_paired() two-sample family functions now show correct levels grouping variable respective calculations .

title: gvsu215 0.1.1
text: general fixes output layout theme, especially two_way() rounding corrections plot_scatter() now allows least squares line drawn bug fix num_sum()

title: gvsu215 0.1.0
text: package functions now usable functions documented functions tests
